page.title: 13History Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Within Dalgety Bay there are a number of places of historical interest. These include the medieval kirk of Saint Bridget and the remains of Donibristle House, the former seat of the Earls of Moray. There are also First and Second World War relics. During the 1914-18 war, gun emplacements were constructed at Braefoot Point to protect the approaches to Rosyth naval base further up the Firth of Forth. A pier also at Braefoot Point still remains. This was used for the offloading of supplies and munitions. During the Second World War, numerous pill boxes, anti-aircraft guns and buildings to house the troops were built. The function of the troops was to guard the airfield. These wartime relics can be seen at Braefoot Point.
